text: back in Washington Donald and Melania
Trump arrived home from the g20 summit
in Germany
to face more questions about the
president's relationship with Russia
following his first face-to-face meeting
with President Putin Donald Trump
suggested the two countries could work
together on a cybersecurity unit but
following criticism from his own party
the president appeared to back down on
the idea in a tweet he said the fact
that President Putin and I discussed a
cybersecurity unit doesn't mean I think
it can happen the president is still
under huge pressure over claims of
Russian interference in last year's
election there's not anybody that thinks
that Russia didn't meddle in the
elections I think we all are very clear
on that and I think we're going to see
what Congress does but the key issue
isn't what Russia did is where the Trump
team colluded with Russia to influence
the election and that for the FBI and
Congress are investigating now the New
York Times says they have evidence at
least some in the campaign were willing
to accept Russian help
they say sources have told them
president Trump's eldest son Donald
Trump jr. and his son-in-law Jared
Krishna met with this woman
Natalya vessel Mnet's kaya a Russian
lawyer with links to the Kremlin in June
last year on the promise of being given
damaging information about Hillary
Clinton Trump jr. has denied anything of
significance came from the meeting
Donald Trump has made it clear he didn't
know anything about it but this is
thought to be the first confirmed
meeting between a Russian national and a
member of the president's inner circle
no doubt investigators will be keen to
know more about how and why it came
about
Samantha Simmons BBC news
